Package io.github.goldmensch

Interface Jall<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The output format of the localized message, normally determined by the Transformer
All Known Implementing Classes:
JallImpl
public interface Jall<T>
The main entry point of the localizer A Jall localizer contains a Localization for each registerd Locale

  • Method Details

    • create

      static <T> Jall<T> create​(@NotNull @NotNull Locale fallback, @NotNull @NotNull Transformer<T> transformer, @NotNull @NotNull PlaceholderResolver resolver)
      Creates a new JallImpl
      Parameters:
      fallback - The fallback Locale which is used if no Localization is found for the needed Locale
      transformer - A Transformer which transform the String from the Localizer to the needed format
      resolver - A PlaceholderResolver which resolves the placeholders in a localization
      Returns:
      A new Jall

    • createStandard

      static Jall<String> createStandard​(@NotNull @NotNull Locale fallback)
      Creates a standard JallImpl with:
      • StringTransformer as the Transformer
      • StringTransformer as the PlaceholderResolver
      Parameters:
      fallback - The fallback Locale which is used if no Localization is found for the needed Locale
      Returns:
      A new Jall

    • register

      void register​(@NotNull @NotNull Localization localization, boolean override)
      Registers a Localization, only one Localization can be registered per Locale
      Parameters:
      localization - The Localization to be registered
      override - Controls if the Localization should override the registered one
      Throws:
      LocExistInRegistryException - if the Locale is already registered and is false

    • localize

      T localize​(@NotNull @NotNull String key, @NotNull @NotNull Locale locale, Replacement... replacements)
      Localize a message using the and the
      Parameters:
      key - The key which belongs to the localization
      locale - The Locale which should be used to localize, if no Localization is found for the Locale the fallback Locale will use
      replacements - The optional Replacement which should be used in the PlaceholderResolver
      Returns:
      The localization transformed to the needed format by the Transformer

    • getFallbackLocale

      @NotNull @NotNull Locale getFallbackLocale()
      Returns:
      The fallback Locale

    • getRegistry

      @NotNull @NotNull Registry getRegistry()
      Returns:
      A Registry.UnmodifiableRegistry of the registry that belongs to this Jall
